evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Networking anxiety, freezing during career fair conversations, uncertainty about follow-ups. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Reframing networking as learning, preparing simple questions, brainstorming industry-specific follow-ups. 3) Student's response to solutions: Positive engagement—proposed natural transitions and tailored journalism scenarios. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Reduced anxiety score, demonstrated ability to link concepts (deadlines → memorable stories), and identified actionable next steps.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Casey expressed overwhelming anxiety about networking and finding a job after graduation, particularly freezing up during conversations at career fairs. Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested reframing networking as 'learning from others,' starting with familiar contacts like professors, and preparing specific questions and follow-up transitions. Student's response to solutions: Casey found the reframing helpful, crafted insightful follow-up questions, and recognized the value of structured transitions. Evidence of progress/improvement: Casey planned to practice with classmates and apply the structured approach in real conversations, showing reduced anxiety and increased confidence.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Anxiety about networking and job search, 2) Difficulty starting and maintaining professional conversations, 3) Fear of appearing interrogative. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Reframing networking as learning, 2) Preparing specific questions and follow-ups, 3) Practicing conversational transitions. Student's response to solutions: Positive, with clear understanding and application of techniques. Evidence of progress/improvement: Student crafted effective transitions, plans to practice with classmates, and feels less anxious with structured approach.
